info.title: ApiManagementClient
info.description: Use these REST APIs for performing operations on Diagnostic entity associated with your Azure API Management deployment. Diagnostics are used to log requests/responses in the APIM proxy.

get.description: Lists all diagnostics of the API Management service instance.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: |   Field     |     Usage     |     Supported operators     |     Supported functions     |</br>|-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|</br>| name | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of records to return.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

alwaysLog.description: Specifies for what type of messages sampling settings should not apply.

bytes.description: Number of request body bytes to log.

headers.description: Array of HTTP Headers to log.

bytes.description: Number of request body bytes to log.

headers.description: Array of HTTP Headers to log.

backend.description: Diagnostic settings for incoming/outgoing HTTP messages to the Gateway.

bytes.description: Number of request body bytes to log.

headers.description: Array of HTTP Headers to log.

bytes.description: Number of request body bytes to log.

headers.description: Array of HTTP Headers to log.

frontend.description: Diagnostic settings for incoming/outgoing HTTP messages to the Gateway.

httpCorrelationProtocol.description: Sets correlation protocol to use for Application Insights diagnostics.

logClientIp.description: Log the ClientIP. Default is false.

loggerId.description: Resource Id of a target logger.

percentage.description: Rate of sampling for fixed-rate sampling.

verbosity.description: The verbosity level applied to traces emitted by trace policies.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

get.description: Gets the details of the Diagnostic specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: diagnosticId
parameters.description: Diagnostic identifier. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Diagnostic entity.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

headers.description: Array of HTTP Headers to log.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: diagnosticId
parameters.description: Diagnostic identifier. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. ETag should match the current entity state from the header response of the GET request or it should be * for unconditional update.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

head.description: Gets the entity state (Etag) version of the Diagnostic specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: diagnosticId

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Gets the entity tag of the diagnostic

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.
